back_cards.example_en: She had to admit her mistake to the team.

back_cards.definition_en: To allow entry to a place.
back_cards.example_en: The guard will admit you after checking your ID.

back_cards.definition_en: To accept someone into an institution.
back_cards.example_en: The hospital admitted him for observation.

back_cards.definition_en: To concede a point in an argument.
back_cards.example_en: I admit you were right about the plan.
He admitted he hadn’t finished the project.

back_cards.definition_en: A greeting to start a conversation.
back_cards.example_en: She said hello to everyone at the party.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to answer the phone.
back_cards.example_en: Hello, who’s this speaking?
Hello, can you hear me over there?

back_cards.definition_en: A friendly welcome in social settings.
back_cards.example_en: He waved and shouted hello to his neighbor.
Her email started with a simple hello.

back_cards.definition_en: Moving to a position on something.
back_cards.example_en: She climbed onto the roof to fix a leak.
I’m onto your plan to surprise me.
Let’s move onto the next agenda item.
The cat jumped onto the table.
We’re onto the final phase of the project.
We sailed across the sea to reach the island.
A sea of people filled the stadium.
The sea is calm today for fishing.
The Mediterranean Sea is popular for cruises.
She navigated a sea of difficulties at work.

back_cards.definition_en: An expression of agreement or approval.
back_cards.example_en: Okay, I’ll meet you at six.
Okay, I get how the app works now.

back_cards.definition_en: A signal to proceed in conversation.
back_cards.example_en: Okay, what’s the next step?
Don’t worry, everything’s okay.

back_cards.definition_en: A response to check on status.
back_cards.example_en: Is everyone okay after the game?

back_cards.definition_en: The opening for eating and speaking.
back_cards.example_en: She covered her mouth while coughing.

back_cards.definition_en: An entrance or exit, like a river’s.
back_cards.example_en: The river’s mouth feeds into the ocean.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to express speech or opinion.
back_cards.example_en: Word of mouth spread the news quickly.
His wide mouth gave him a friendly look.
The dentist examined her mouth carefully.

back_cards.definition_en: In every part of a place or thing.
back_cards.example_en: Flowers bloomed throughout the garden.

back_cards.definition_en: During an entire period of time.
back_cards.example_en: She worked throughout the weekend.
The festival was celebrated throughout the city.

back_cards.definition_en: In all aspects of a situation.
back_cards.example_en: His influence is felt throughout the company.
The theme runs throughout the novel.
She built her own business from scratch.
I have my own room in the house.
He prefers to work on his own.
That’s my own decision to make.
She has her own style of painting.
The math test was challenging.
The new car passed the safety test.
The doctor ordered a blood test.
We ran a test on the software.

back_cards.definition_en: A challenge in a competitive setting.
back_cards.example_en: The race was a test of endurance.

back_cards.definition_en: A network created by a spider.
back_cards.example_en: A spider’s web was in the corner.

back_cards.definition_en: The internet or World Wide Web.
back_cards.example_en: I found the article on the web.
She’s caught in a web of lies.
The web of links made navigation easy.
The web of relationships shaped the team.

back_cards.definition_en: To move something back and forth.
back_cards.example_en: Shake the bottle before opening it.

back_cards.definition_en: To tremble due to emotion or cold.
back_cards.example_en: He was shaking with fear during the storm.
The news shook her confidence.

back_cards.definition_en: To mix or blend by moving.
back_cards.example_en: Shake the ingredients to make a smoothie.
I can’t shake this cold.

back_cards.definition_en: A statement of intent to harm.
back_cards.example_en: The letter contained a serious threat.
Climate change is a global threat.
The company faced a threat of a strike.
He saw the dog as a threat.
Cyber threats are increasing daily.
We found a solution to the puzzle.

back_cards.definition_en: A method to resolve an issue.
back_cards.example_en: The team proposed a solution for delays.
The solution turned blue during the experiment.
Their solution boosted sales significantly.
The software update was the solution.
Please shut the door quietly.
The factory shut down for repairs.
He shut her argument with facts.
They shut the windows before the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: To end a process or activity.
back_cards.example_en: The shop shuts at 6 p.m.

back_cards.definition_en: Toward a lower position or level.
back_cards.example_en: She walked down the stairs carefully.
Sales are down this quarter.

back_cards.definition_en: In a direction away from the speaker.
back_cards.example_en: Drive down the road to find the store.

back_cards.definition_en: In a state of being non-functional.
back_cards.example_en: The website is down for maintenance.
I wrote down all the instructions.

back_cards.definition_en: To journey from one place to another.
back_cards.example_en: We plan to travel to Europe next summer.
News travels fast in a small town.
He travels daily to the city for his job.
She loves to travel and try new foods.
The bill is traveling through Congress.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who conducts scientific research.
back_cards.example_en: The scientist discovered a new species.

back_cards.definition_en: An expert in a scientific field.
back_cards.example_en: She’s a scientist specializing in physics.
Scientists developed the new vaccine.
The scientist published a groundbreaking paper.
Our scientist tested the new theory.
The kids love to hide during games.

back_cards.definition_en: To cover or keep something secret.
back_cards.example_en: She hid her diary under the bed.
The fog hid the mountain from sight.
He tried to hide his disappointment.
They hid the treasure in a cave.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that is clear or apparent.
back_cards.example_en: She was obviously upset about the news.
Obviously, we need more time to finish.
He’s obviously the best candidate.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in casual conversation for emphasis.
back_cards.example_en: It’s obviously going to rain soon.
The solution was obviously correct.

back_cards.definition_en: To mention or direct attention to.
back_cards.example_en: She referred to the book during her speech.

back_cards.definition_en: To send someone to a source.
back_cards.example_en: The doctor referred me to a specialist.
I’ll refer to the manual for instructions.

back_cards.definition_en: To relate or apply to something.
back_cards.example_en: The rule doesn’t refer to this case.
He referred a friend for the job.
